content:
Hey RA folks, I've been working on a interactive static analysis tool for some time. I've had to implement a shitton of annoying stuff around VScode integration, and also source-mapping from the user's selection to Rust program nodes. These are largely solved problems in RA, so I would love to build on RA instead. But I can't use RA b/c I need the MIR for key facts of the analysis (e.g. lifetimes / outlives).

How likely is it that RA would support MIR within the next year? Either b/c rustc adopts RA infrastructure or vice versa.
I think getting libraryfication of rustc far enough to make MIR support in RA feasible will take at least several years.
